docs.abstract: While public health experts warn people to take precautions, these popular media figures insist that the virus is overhyped.
docs.snippet: While public health experts warn people to take precautions, these popular media figures insist that the virus is overhyped.
docs.lead_paragraph: Misinformation about the coronavirus continues to circulate across swaths of the American media — on popular podcasts, in blog posts, in online videos and on prime-time cable news shows — as recently as this week.

headline.main: From Jerry Falwell Jr. to Dr. Drew: 5 Coronavirus Doubters

docs.abstract: Welcome to On Tech, a daily newsletter on how technology is changing all of our lives — for better or worse.
docs.snippet: Welcome to On Tech, a daily newsletter on how technology is changing all of our lives — for better or worse.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hello and welcome! The pandemic has turned everything we know upside down, and we are relying on technology more than ever to work, go to school, stay informed, entertain ourselves and stay connected to people we love.

headline.main: Why a Pandemic Is Bringing Out Our Best Online

docs.abstract: A Ford Model A that has been part of one family’s lives across five generations got a 30-year restoration.
docs.snippet: A Ford Model A that has been part of one family’s lives across five generations got a 30-year restoration.
docs.lead_paragraph: DENVER — “We’ll get this done by the end of summer.”

headline.main: A Family Heirloom, Restored From Hood to Taillights

docs.abstract: The central bank is weighing what it can do to help local bond markets. Here’s why Democrats’ big ask — direct purchases — is so tough.
docs.snippet: The central bank is weighing what it can do to help local bond markets. Here’s why Democrats’ big ask — direct purchases — is so tough.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rhode Island will miss out on $300 million in revenue in March and early April as coronavirus delays income tax filings, while shuttered casinos cost state coffers another $1 million per day. Expenses, meantime, are through the roof — the state spent $7 million on ventilators on Monday alone.

headline.main: Why State and Local Debt Is Fraught Territory for the Fed
headline.print_headline: Why Buying State and Local Debt Is Fraught Territory for the Central Bank

docs.abstract: The sudden silence of Ren Zhiqiang, a vocal member of the Communist Party, signals a retreat from the principles that led China out of poverty.
docs.snippet: The sudden silence of Ren Zhiqiang, a vocal member of the Communist Party, signals a retreat from the principles that led China out of poverty.
docs.lead_paragraph: Weeks before Ren Zhiqiang disappeared, leading to fears among his friends and fans that he had been picked up by the Chinese authorities, the 69-year-old former property mogul locked himself up.

headline.main: A Loyal Chinese Critic Vanishes, in a Blow to the Nation’s Future
headline.print_headline: A Longtime Party Insider Vanishes, in a Blow to China’s Future

docs.abstract: When the coronavirus crisis required ramping factories to make ventilators, the government’s ability to harness factory capacity crumpled.
docs.snippet: When the coronavirus crisis required ramping factories to make ventilators, the government’s ability to harness factory capacity crumpled.
docs.lead_paragraph: The goal of “opening up” the U.S. economy by April 12 didn’t last long — social-distancing guidelines have been extended to April 30. (Want this in your inbox each morning? Sign up here.)

headline.main: A Failure of Policy and Planning

docs.abstract: While many start-ups grapple with the fallout from the pandemic, this San Francisco company raised more cash to survive.
docs.snippet: While many start-ups grapple with the fallout from the pandemic, this San Francisco company raised more cash to survive.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The spread of the coronavirus has meant feast or famine for technology start-ups. While many are cutting staff and slashing costs as they reel from the outbreak’s fallout, others have experienced a surge in demand.

headline.main: Notion, Maker of Collaboration Software, Raises $50 Million
headline.print_headline: Remote Work Start-Up Was in the Slow Lane. Then Came Pandemic.

docs.abstract: Traders scour factories and warehouses, find planes and pilots and look for buyers as hospitals and governments beg for protective gear.
docs.snippet: Traders scour factories and warehouses, find planes and pilots and look for buyers as hospitals and governments beg for protective gear.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Million-dollar wire transfers to strangers. Rumors of hidden supplies in forgotten warehouses. Wheeler-dealers trying to talk regulators and customs officials into letting that one precious shipment through.

headline.main: Coronavirus Battle Creates a Global ‘Free-for-All’ to Find Masks
headline.print_headline: The Tortuous Path From Factory to Face

docs.abstract: If you have some spare time at home and want a productive project, consider creating a digital archive of your personal papers.
docs.snippet: If you have some spare time at home and want a productive project, consider creating a digital archive of your personal papers.
docs.lead_paragraph: While this week’s World Backup Day is typically celebrated most by hard-drive makers and data-storage services, it’s supposed to make people remember to back up their computers. But even if you’re already backing up your digital files, do you have a backup plan for your one-of-a-kind documents and photos that you have only on paper — like birth certificates, marriage licenses and military-discharge papers?

headline.main: How to Digitize Your Most Important Documents

docs.abstract: The $2 trillion relief bill will send money directly to Americans, greatly expand unemployment coverage and make a number of other changes.
docs.snippet: The $2 trillion relief bill will send money directly to Americans, greatly expand unemployment coverage and make a number of other changes.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump has signed a bipartisan $2 trillion economic relief plan to offer assistance to tens of millions of American households affected by the coronavirus pandemic. Its components include stimulus payments to individuals, expanded unemployment coverage, student loan changes, different retirement account rules and more.

headline.main: F.A.Q. on Stimulus Checks, Unemployment and the Coronavirus Plan

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020)

byline.original: By Tara Siegel Bernard and Ron Lieber
